content:
Diagnosis:
Peritoneal epithelioid mesothelioma, T3N0M0
Diagnosed March 2024 via laparoscopic biopsy
PD-L1 TPS 40%

Treatment:
Cycle 3 of 6 nivolumab/ipilimumab combination immunotherapy on MARS3 trial

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Nivolumab 360mg q3w
Ipilimumab 1mg/kg q6w
Amlodipine 5mg od
Metformin 1g bd

Current situation:
CT assessment post cycle 3 shows partial response with reduction in peritoneal disease volume

Trial assessments:
No grade 3-4 immune-related adverse events
Liver function tests stable
TFTs within normal range
Cortisol normal

Current symptoms:
Mild fatigue (grade 1)
Appetite improving
Abdominal pain resolved
No new symptoms

Examination:
PS 1
Soft abdomen
No ascites
Normal chest examination

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 4 of immunotherapy. He has shown excellent tolerance of treatment with only grade 1 fatigue. His recent CT scan shows encouraging partial response with approximately 40% reduction in peritoneal disease volume compared to baseline. His quality of life has significantly improved with resolution of his previous abdominal pain. Blood tests show no evidence of immune-related adverse events. He remains eligible to continue on trial and I am happy to proceed with cycle 4 today. Next review will be in 3 weeks with repeat blood tests and toxicity assessment as per protocol.
